E0001.title: unexpected token
E0001.description: The parser encountered a token that doesn't fit the expected grammar at the current position.

E0002.title: unexpected end of file
E0002.description: The parser reached the end of the file but was expecting more code to complete a syntactic construct.

E0003.title: expected token
E0003.description: The parser expected a specific token but found something else.

E0004.title: invalid literal
E0004.description: A literal value (number, string, etc.) is malformed and cannot be parsed correctly.

E0005.title: unclosed delimiter
E0005.description: An opening delimiter (parenthesis, brace, or bracket) is not matched by a corresponding closing delimiter.

E0006.title: expected type
E0006.description: The parser expected a type annotation but found something else.

E0007.title: expected expression
E0007.description: The parser expected an expression but found something else (like a keyword, delimiter, or end of statement).

E0008.title: expected pattern
E0008.description: The parser expected a pattern (for matching or binding) but found something else.

E0009.title: invalid attribute
E0009.description: An attribute (annotation starting with @) is malformed or not recognized.

E0100.title: cannot find value in this scope
E0100.description: Attempted to use a variable that hasn't been declared in the current scope.

E0101.title: cannot find function in this scope
E0101.description: Attempted to call a function that hasn't been defined or imported into the current scope.

E0102.title: cannot find type in this scope
E0102.description: Referenced a type that hasn't been defined or imported into the current scope.

E0103.title: cannot find struct in this scope
E0103.description: Attempted to use a struct that hasn't been defined or imported into the current scope.

E0104.title: no field on type
E0104.description: Attempted to access a field that doesn't exist on a struct type.

E0105.title: cannot find enum in this scope
E0105.description: Attempted to use an enum type that hasn't been defined or imported into the current scope.

E0106.title: no variant on enum
E0106.description: Attempted to use an enum variant that doesn't exist on the enum type.

E0107.title: no method found
E0107.description: Attempted to call a method that doesn't exist on the type.

E0108.title: cannot find trait in this scope
E0108.description: Referenced a trait that hasn't been defined or imported into the current scope.

E0109.title: duplicate definition
E0109.description: Defined something (variable, function, struct, etc.) with a name that's already in use in the same scope.

E0200.title: mismatched types
E0200.description: The compiler expected one type but found another.

E0201.title: wrong number of arguments
E0201.description: A function was called with a different number of arguments than it was defined to accept.

E0202.title: wrong number of type arguments
E0202.description: A generic type or function was instantiated with the wrong number of type parameters.

E0203.title: trait not implemented
E0203.description: Attempted to use functionality that requires a trait implementation, but the type doesn't implement that trait.

E0204.title: invalid cast
E0204.description: Attempted to cast a value to a type that is not compatible with the source type.

E0205.title: cannot infer type
E0205.description: The compiler cannot determine the type of an expression from context and needs an explicit type annotation.

E0300.title: break outside of loop
E0300.description: Used the break keyword outside of a loop construct (while, for, loop).

E0301.title: continue outside of loop
E0301.description: Used the continue keyword outside of a loop construct (while, for, loop).

E0302.title: return in closure
E0302.description: Attempted to use return to exit from an enclosing function from within a closure.

E0303.title: await outside of async function
E0303.description: Used the await keyword outside of an async function or block.

E0304.title: yield outside of generator
E0304.description: Used the yield keyword outside of a generator function.

E0305.title: self outside of impl block
E0305.description: Used self outside of a method in an impl block.

E0400.title: file not found
E0400.description: The compiler cannot find a source file that was specified or imported.

E0401.title: cannot read file
E0401.description: The compiler found a file but cannot read its contents.

parse.name: Parse Errors
parse.description: Errors that occur during parsing of source code

name_resolution.name: Name Resolution Errors
name_resolution.description: Errors related to finding and resolving names (variables, functions, types)

type.name: Type Errors
type.description: Errors related to type checking and type inference

semantic.name: Semantic Errors
semantic.description: Errors related to semantic analysis (control flow, scoping, etc.)

io.name: IO Errors
io.description: Errors related to file and module operations
